body: I know why you can't unzip my zip package. My zip package is compressed with WinRAR tool.Strangely enough, it works when the password is set to numbers or letters, but it doesn't work when the password is in Chinese.I used Zip4j to add a ZIP file, and the password was in Chinese. I tried to unzip it with WinRAR tool, but it showed me that the password was wrong. I think the root reason should be that your algorithm is different.Is there any way to decompress WinRAR compressed files?It would help me a lot.

I have identified the issue. I will work on a fix and include this in the next release.

Edit: The issue is that any non-ascii passwords have to be utf-8 encoded before using it for encryption.
When I use WinRAR to encrypt the file, and the password is in Chinese, in the case of knowing the password, can your zip4j decrypt?

Yes, I think it should work. I do not have WiinRAR, but I can reproduce the behaviour with Keka on Mac. After converting your password to utf-8 it works fine with Keka. I think WinRAR should have the same behaviour.

I have made a snapshot release with the fix. Please test with version `2.6.5-SNAPSHOT` and confirm if this works. I have tested it on mac with Chinese password (from your code) and it works fine now with other tools (Keka, The Unarchiver, etc). I will include this fix in the next release. If you have trouble getting the snapshot version, please check [this][1] answer.

[1]: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/7715321/how-to-download-snapshot-version-from-maven-snapshot-repository

I have installed the snapshot into my local Maven warehouse for testing, but the previous problem still exists. Do you have a Windows environment to test it?Can you unzip my zip after you fix the program?

I tried it on a windows machine and it works fine with WinRaR now after the fix. As the bug is during the creation of the zip file, please note that a zip file already created with a previous version of zip4j cannot be extracted anymore. The zip file has to be created with the new snapshot version of zip4j. So, the zip file attached to this issue cannot be extracted anymore as this was created before the fix.

As mentioned, I created the zip file with the snapshot version of zip4j and was successfully able to extract it with WinRaR.

issue.title: Problem encrypting using accents

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

repository.name: zip4j
repository.description: A Java library for zip files and streams

issue.body:
**The library allows you to encrypt with accents, however it fails when trying to decrypt with the same password.**
Example: try to decrypt using the password 'útil'

```
Caused by: net.lingala.zip4j.exception.ZipException: Wrong Password
        at net.lingala.zip4j.crypto.AESDecrypter.init(AESDecrypter.java:76)
        at net.lingala.zip4j.crypto.AESDecrypter.<init>(AESDecrypter.java:50)
        at net.lingala.zip4j.io.inputstream.AesCipherInputStream.initializeDecrypter(AesCipherInputStream.java:37)
        at net.lingala.zip4j.io.inputstream.AesCipherInputStream.initializeDecrypter(AesCipherInputStream.java:18)
        at net.lingala.zip4j.io.inputstream.CipherInputStream.<init>(CipherInputStream.java:24)
        at net.lingala.zip4j.io.inputstream.AesCipherInputStream.<init>(AesCipherInputStream.java:32)
        at net.lingala.zip4j.io.inputstream.ZipInputStream.initializeCipherInputStream(ZipInputStream.java:196)
        at net.lingala.zip4j.io.inputstream.ZipInputStream.initializeEntryInputStream(ZipInputStream.java:186)
        at net.lingala.zip4j.io.inputstream.ZipInputStream.getNextEntry(ZipInputStream.java:103)
        at net.lingala.zip4j.io.inputstream.ZipInputStream.getNextEntry(ZipInputStream.java:77)
```

Thank you !!

body: Is the first use of WinRAR Chinese password encryption, and then use Zip4J decompression can not.

After some playing around and some researching, I think that this is a bug in WinRaR. I created a zip file with `你好` as password in WinRaR, then I tried to extract it with the same password from zip4j, and it did not work and I got a `Wrong Password` exception. But after reading about a [bug in WinRaR][1], I replaced the password with `??` (one question mark for each character), it worked fine. I think WinRaR does not handle non-ascii passwords well when creating the zip file.

[1]: http://anrieff.net/abs/viewpost.php?lang=en&id=40
Issue fixed in v2.7.0 which was released today.

issue.title: Bump zip4j from 1.3.2 to 2.7.0

labels.name: type:dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency

repository.name: allure-maven
repository.description: Maven plugin generating Allure report from test results

issue.body:
Bumps [zip4j](https://github.com/srikanth-lingala/zip4j) from 1.3.2 to 2.7.0.
Release notes

Sourced from zip4j's releases.

v2.7.0

New Features:

  • #216 Set buffer size from ZipFile
  • #278 Option to skip extracting symlinks when extracting zip files

Improvements:

  • #256 Improve message in exception for EncryptionMethod.ZIP_STANDARD_VARIANT_STRONG
  • #266 Change default unix permissions to 644

Bugs:

  • #259 Fix bug when charset is explicitly set to utf-8
  • #263 ZipFile can be constructed with a null File causing NPE some time later
  • #268 File attributes of zipped folders are not applied on extraction
  • #274 Consider external file attributes as well to set directory flag
  • #279 Skip reading until end of entry only for files when data descriptor is set
  • #282 Convert password to utf-8 before encrypting
  • #284 Improve password verification for Zip Standard decryption

v2.6.4

Improvements:

#239 Check if file exists before adding the file to zip #249 Bump junit from 4.12 to 4.13.1 #250 Use Collections.sort instead of List.sort for older Android version compatibility

Bug fixes:

#246 Can't create big archive when zipFile reference not reinitialized

v2.6.3

Improvements:

#241 Switch to SecureRandom for encryption randomness

v2.6.2

Improvements:

  • #202 Validity check for missing split z* files
  • #214 Add a utility method to get the epoch time of the entries
  • #200 #209 #210 #211 #212 #222 Improve README

Bug:

  • #204 Thread for unzipping does not exit when run in another thread
  • #220 Fix entry deletion issue when central directory entries are in different order than local entries
  • #228 Handle Strong encryption with proper error message
  • #231 Missing unix permissions when adding file via stream

... (truncated)

Commits
  • See full diff in compare view

You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---

You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
